uniol.apt.module

Interface Module

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    InterruptibleModule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConvertModule, AbstractGeneratorModule, AbstractInterruptibleModule, AbstractLiveModule, AbstractModule, AbstractSynthesizeModule, AsymmetricChoiceModule, BackwardsPersistentModule, BCFModule, BiCFModule, BisimulationModule, BistatePhilNetGeneratorModule, BitNetGeneratorModule, BoundedModule, CheckAllCyclePropertiesModule, CheckModule, CheckSideConditionsModule, ComputeMinSemiPosInvariantsModule, ConcurrencyPreservingModule, ConflictFreeModule, ConnectedBitNetGeneratorModule, CoverabilityModule, CoveredByInvariantModule, CreateLTSModule,     public interface Module
    A module.
    Author:
    Renke Grunwald

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Category[] getCategories()
      Returns the categories the module belongs to.
      java.lang.String getLongDescription()
      Returns a long description of the module.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the module.
      java.lang.String getShortDescription()
      Returns a short description of the module.

      Returns the title of the module.

      Specify the return values of the module.
      void require(ModuleInputSpec inputSpec)
      Specify the parameters of the module.
      void run(ModuleInput input, ModuleOutput output)
      Perform some computation on the values stored in the ModuleInput object and store the results in the ModuleOutput object.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the module. The name is used to uniquely identify a module. It should be all lower-case with words separated by underscores. It should also be kept simple as it may be typed by a user in order for him to use this module. For example: "example_module".
        Returns:
        the name of the module

      • require

        void require(ModuleInputSpec inputSpec)
        Specify the parameters of the module. To specify a parameter the ModuleInputSpec.addParameter(String, Class, String, String...) method can be used. The order of specified parameters matters.
        Parameters:
        inputSpec - specification of parameters (input values)

      • provide

        void provide(ModuleOutputSpec outputSpec)
        Specify the return values of the module. To specify a return value the ModuleOutputSpec.addReturnValue(String, Class, String...) method can be used. The order of specified return values matters.
        Parameters:
        outputSpec - specification of return values (output values)

      • run

        void run(ModuleInput input,
         ModuleOutput output)
  throws ModuleException
        Perform some computation on the values stored in the ModuleInput object and store the results in the ModuleOutput object. To retrieve values from ModuleInput object the ModuleInput.getParameter(String, Class) method can be used. To store values in the ModuleOutput object the ModuleOutput.setReturnValue(String, Class, Object) method can be used. The possible values in both the ModuleInput and ModuleOutput object are determined entirely by the specifications in the require(ModuleInputSpec) and provide(ModuleOutputSpec) method respectively.
        Parameters:
        input - storage of the inputs
        output - storage of the outputs
        Throws:
        ModuleException - On various kinds of errors that prevent the module from working.

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns the title of the module. It should be shorter than 40 characters and must not contain control characters like newlines. The default implementation in AbstractModule returns getName().
        Returns:
        the title of the module

      • getShortDescription

        java.lang.String getShortDescription()
        Returns a short description of the module. The short description should explain what the module does without going into details. It should be shorter than 70 characters and must not contain control characters like newlines. The default implementation in AbstractModule returns an empty string.
        Returns:
        the short description of the module

      • getLongDescription

        java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        Returns a long description of the module. The long description should contain a detailed explanation of what the module does. It might include example invocations, for instance. This desription has no length limit and may contain newlines. The default implementation in AbstractModule returns getShortDescription().
        Returns:
        the long description of the module

      • getCategories

        Category[] getCategories()
        Returns the categories the module belongs to. The categories are used to improve the module overview making particular modules faster to find. If null is returned the module is automatically assigned to the default category.
        Returns:
        an array of categories
